project.teaser: The overall aim of GREENET is to improve the professionalisation and skills of the Cluster 5 (CL5) National Contact Points (NCPs) across Europe, simplifying applicants’ access to Horizon Europe (HE) calls and raising the average quality of submitted proposals. Starting from...
project.objective: The overall aim of GREENET is to improve the professionalisation and skills of the Cluster 5 (CL5) National Contact Points (NCPs) across Europe, simplifying applicants’ access to Horizon Europe (HE) calls and raising the average quality of submitted proposals. Starting from the assumption that the NCP role is crucial in order to raise the participation in HE in terms of both quality and quantity, the GREENET overall concept is that the CL5 NCP community requires knowledge, skills, competences and a proven comprehensive suite of tools to convey a message in a multicultural and multi-disciplinary environment such as CL5 and to effectively support its broad based constituency. Therefore, the project is based on three pillars: (i) NCPs capacity building and competence development, (ii) development of targeted and high quality services (events and tools) for CL5 applicants and stakeholders , (iii) CL5 community building and general mainstreaming of CL5 NCPs in Horizon Europe.
project.title: NCPS NETwork for the GREEN transition in climate, energy and mobility
project.keywords: Competence development, Capacity building, CL5 NCPs collaboration, CL5 NCPs community, Stakeholders engagement, Awareness raising, Newcomer applicants, Matchmaking, Synergies with relevant actors

article.title: EU cluster on climate, energy and mobility receives a boost

result.title: Third Steering Committee Meetings' Report
result.description: Minutes, meant to be a tool for the monitoring of the activities and a reference for decisions within the consortium. The minutes will emphasise the planning for future activities and they will include the decisions taken by the consortium in order to make sure that the project activities will be carried out properly. Relevant task: T1.2

result.title: 3rd Newsletter
result.description: The Newsletter - 3rd Issue will promote information and news related to Cluster 5 et al. among NCPs and interested stakeholders. Relevant task: T6.3

result.title: 1st Reports on Cluster 5 NCP's training needs
result.description: The 1st analysis on Cluster 5 NCP’s training needs will provide the mapping of the NCPs needs carried out on the basis of questionnaires. The deliverable will inform the WP5 activities. Relevant task: T5.1

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - GREENET (NCPS NETwork for the GREEN transition in climate, energy and mobility)
result.teaser: Horizon Europe (HE) is the EU's flagship R&I funding program designed to drive scientific excellence, technological innovation, and societal impact. It is organized into several thematic clusters, each focusing on key challenges and strategic priorities. Cluster 5 (CL5)...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: NCP Training Path Guide
result.description: The NCP Training Path Guide will outline a series of training sessions to be attended by newly appointed NCPs in order to gather the basic pieces of knowledge to properly approach their NCP role. Relevant task: T5.2

result.title: Report on mapping of potential target value chains, groups and stakeholders and related entry barriers
result.description: Mapping of potential target value chains, groups and stakeholders and related entry barriers in the widening countries, to be used as a reference to shape the WP3 activities (e.g. actors to engoge, sectors to focus on). Relevant task: T3.1

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
